Hello! It's great to meet you. I'm Felicia, and I love blending retro gaming with handcrafted soap and Caribbean culture.
I'm Brielle, and I'm all about connecting warmth, tradition, innovation, and curiosity through bread, retro video game consoles, and vintage bicycle rides.
Wow, that's such a unique combination! I'd love to hear more about how you connect curiosity and innovation with bread.

Absolutely! I'm always experimenting with new recipes and techniques to create unique loaves of bread. For example, I recently started using a sourdough starter that I cultivated myself, which adds a depth of flavor that you can't get with commercial yeast. I also enjoy incorporating unexpected ingredients, like herbs, spices, and even edible flowers.

That sounds amazing! I'm always looking for ways to incorporate more natural and organic ingredients into my soap-making process. I love the idea of blending different scents and textures to create a unique experience for my customers.
I can imagine that there are a lot of parallels between our processes. We're both taking something that is traditionally quite simple and adding our own unique spin to it.

Definitely. I also love the nostalgia factor of retro gaming. There's something so satisfying about playing a game that you loved as a child, especially when it's on a console that you remember using.

I couldn't agree more! I still have my old Nintendo 64 and a few of my favorite games. There's something so comforting about playing those games, even though the graphics are quite dated compared to what's available today.
And I think that's what makes retro gaming so special. It's not just about the graphics or the gameplay, it's about the memories and the emotions that are tied to those experiences.
Absolutely. And I think the same can be said for bread and soap-making. There's something so satisfying about creating something with your own hands and putting your own unique spin on it.
I couldn't agree more! It's always so rewarding to see the finished product and know that you created it yourself.
Definitely. I'm so glad that we were able to connect and share our passions with each other.
Me too! I can't wait to see what new and exciting things you come up with in your bread-making journey.
